author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: أَصْنامَ الهَوى بِقُدْرَتِكَ وَسُلْطانِكَ وَما مَنَعَهُمْ عَنْ شَطْرِ فَضْلِكَ ما عِنْدَ بَرِيَّتِكَ، قَدْ خَرَقُوا الأَحْجابَ عَلَى شَأْنٍ ناحَتْ سُكَّانُ مَدائِنِ الهَوى وَفَزِعَتْ أَصْحابُ الغِلِّ وَالفَحْشآءِ الَّذِينَ زَيَّنُوا رُؤُوسَهُمْ وَأَبْدانَهُمْ بِأَسْبابِ العِلْمِ وَبِها اسْتَكْبَرُوا عَلَى نَفْسِكَ وَأَعْرَضُوا عَنْ جَمالِكَ، أَيْ رَبِّ أَسْئَلُكَ بِمَجْدِكَ العَظِيمِ وَاسْمِكَ القَدِيمِ
translation: I render Thee thanks that Thou hast made known unto me such servants as have utterly abolished, by the power of Thy might and of Thy sovereignty, the idols of their corrupt desires, and were not kept back by the things which are possessed by Thy creatures from turning in the direction of Thy grace. These have so vehemently rent the veils asunder that the dwellers of the cities of self have wept, and fear and trembling seized the people of envy and wickedness who, adorning their heads and their bodies with the emblems of knowledge, have proudly rejected Thee and turned away from Thy beauty.
